content.rendered:
We reserve appointments every day for emergency patients or you can call our Lifeline Wisdom Dental hotline after hours or on weekends for help.

 

  • Prompt answer and problem-solving
  • Emergency same day appointments
  • Help over the phone
  • Available 24/7

 

Dental emergencies can present in any shape or form including toothache, a broken or dislocated tooth, bleeding gums or, in very rare cases, dislocation of the jaw. You can call on our hotline number after hours where you will be assisted and given an appointment as soon as possible and you will be guided according to how urgent your dental emergency is.

Feel free to call our hotline (insert number) after 5 pm on Mondays to Fridays or all day on Saturdays and Sundays to book the earliest available appointment.

 

What to do if you have a dental emergency:

If you have:

  • A broken or chipped tooth
  • Swollen and painful gums
  • Severe pain in your jaw
  • Severe toothache
  • Dislocation of the jaw bone
  • Any kind of injury to the mouth or teeth
  • Post procedure complications

Then you could be in need of emergency intervention.

Call our clinic from 9 AM-5 PM from Monday to Friday to get booked in for the nearest available appointment. We reserve spots for emergency appointments every day. Over the weekend, you can call our hotline which is available 24/7 and we will fit you in at the earliest opportunity. The hotline is also there to help you and can assess your situation and give you some temporary solutions till our dentists can see you.

What to expect when you contact us for an emergency appointment

  • When you call our clinic or our helpline, we assess the severity of the situation. If it is too severe and you cannot be booked in right away, we can suggest that you go into a hospital emergency till your appointment.
  • Once your dental emergency is assessed, we book you in for the earliest available appointment.
  • When you come in to our clinic, our team of highly qualified dentists will assess your situation and give you treatment options and advice based on their findings and the urgency of your problem.
  • Coverage from your health fund depends on the kind of treatment required so please confirm with your health insurance provider. We strive to help our patients and these are all the major health funds we accept:

 

  • HIF
  • CUA
  • HCF
  • BUPA
  • AHM
  • Frank
  • CDH Benefits
  • CBHS health fund
  • HBF
  • GMHBA
  • MediBank
  • Australian Unity

 

Tips for what do to in a dental emergency:

  • If you are in severe pain, it is okay to take over-the-counter pain medication for a few days but it is not advisable to delay the problem such as pain in your gums or root canal as it can cause more serious problems in the future.
  • If you are experiencing tooth pain, rinse your mouth with warm salty water while you wait for your appointment. If possible gently floss around the tooth that hurts to remove any food particles that may be exacerbating the pain.
  • If you are experiencing severe sensitivity in your teeth or tooth pain while biting down on something or a persisting pain or swelling in your jaw or tooth, it is a sign that you might need to get a root canal treatment.
  • If your tooth gets knocked out by dental injury or accident, don’t panic. Clean and save the knocked out tooth by putting it in milk. Be careful not to touch the tooth by the root end and to only handle it by the crown end so the roots do not get damaged. Once you have saved the tooth, call our practice immediately and we will book you in on the nearest available appointment.
  • If you have any post-surgery complications from an extraction or root canal such as infection which can be identified by pain and swelling around the affected area or you may experience a fever, call our clinic immediately and you will be booked in as soon as possible.
